Reviews.Title: “This place should be condemed”
Reviews.Author: Leah H
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at this hotel the room they provided to us had dirty sheets and towels and had not be cleaned at all. This was at 10.00 at night. Then They gave us a new room and once we left that room we couldn't get back in because the lock was broken. We had to use phsyical force to open the door with the help of the maintenance. The room had been broken into the door frame and lock had all been splintered and bent. They advertise on the internet and at the hotel that they are newly rennovated. What rubbish. Perhpas at a stretch, you could call new lino on the floors a new rennovation. The pictures they put up on the webpage look NOTHING like the rooms. The room we had was musty and damp and Orlando was hot. The aircontioning did not work properly. The plug in the bathroom tap did not work so we had to use a knife to open the hole to let the water out. The washing machine was broken and couldn't use it and on the last day they only gave us one towel as they couldn;t was all the hotel linen.The fridge was crap too and didn't work properly as it was all iced up. The shuttle bus only goes three times a day and the hotel is not a convienent location to anything. It cost as nearly $50.00 to get there by taxi from the airport.We had to hire a car so that we could get around otherwise we would have been trapped there. Generally speaking it has horrid. It was very cheap but i was annoyed as they sold themselves as being newly rennovated. This is just not true. These places should be made to tell the truth to people so they know what they are getting. DO NOT STAY THERE> The staff couldn't care less and will not assist to make things better.

Reviews.Title: “Not a two star”
Reviews.Author: SPXW_CL_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Priceline shows this is a 2 star hotel. NOT a two star hotel, for multiple reasons. I happen to luck out when I checked in (about 1a on a Friday) there was no one ahead of me. Out of our group, 7 rooms and all of us arriving at different times, I was the only one who didn't have to wait at least 45 minutes for check in due to the slowness of the front desk staff. Others from our group checked in around the 1a time frame on different days and they waited, and waited. Now to the rooms, the best that I can say is adequate, barely. The rooms weren't always cleaned (some days no housekeeping showed up) and when they were "cleaned" they weren't cleaned too thoroughly. We were there for work so no one really had time to use the pool, which appeared to be nice, though there were people in the pool all hours of the night.... Specific to the room, my AC unit blew directly on to one of the beds, I put a chair between the bed and the unit so I wasn't in a cold draft all night. Another from our group had a room (the 3rd one that he tried) with no AC working. A couple of days my keys stopped working and the line at the front desk was long and it took a while to get the cards re-programmed. Over all this is a poor quality establishment. None of us tried the continental breakfast, lack of cleanliness of the rooms left us not trusting what the food choices might be. The best thing about this hotel is it's location, close to Gaylord Convention center, dining, and all Disney locations.

Reviews.Title: “Hole in the wall- Literally”
Reviews.Author: surgeon83
Reviews.Content: The man ahead of me in the extremely long checkout line left cussing and warning other people to go elsewhere after he talked to the attendant, who just rolled his eyes. I should have left as he advised! The outside of the buildings looks like a prison. Read the other '1' reviews, they are all true. The rooms are not cleaned in between guests- there was DOGFOOD all over the floor, BUGS everywhere especially in the sink (which had a hole rusted in it), the vanity top was formica-covered particle board which (obviously) had gotten wet and was warped, there was a USED BAR OF SOAP with a huge wad of HAIR tangled into it sitting in the corner of the tub (which at first I though was something they were using to plug a hole), there was a fist-sized hole busted through the wall in the shower, there was no shower curtain, and there was no remote for the old tube TV but it only had 5 fuzzy stations anyway. This place was so depressing, even though I paid for 2 nights I left after 1 because I couldn't stand it. Claremont Kissimmee is a nightmare and not even worth the $35 I paid.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT EVEN THINK OF IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: June J
Reviews.Content: This was the most scary experience I have ever had. We arrived at our allocated room to discover the door was slightly open due to it having been forced the door frame was split therefore the key card did not work. There were gangs of unsavoury looking people hanging around the walkways to the room. The whole impression of the place was dirty and neglected. Ok it was very cheap but show the real photographs of the place on the internet!! We could not (nor wanted to) enter the room so I can not comment on it. Needless to say we did not stay here and quickly got away. Proves to me that you have to be very careful of booking on the internet!!

Reviews.Title: “hotel of poor quality”
Reviews.Author: J H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in March. On a screen in reception it said the rooms had been refurbishes, not our room it looked like it could have done with a coat of paint, the wooded floor was sticky. The bath room was just about ok, but we didn't venture a shower the shower curtain was dirty and the sealant around the floor tiles was grubby and neaded replacing. I'm glad we only stayed there for 2 nights I would'nt have to have been there any longer. BJ

Reviews.Title: “Walk to Eateries and Souvenirs”
Reviews.Author: Tessmarica
Reviews.Content: Got to this motel at 2pm and we checked right in to the two rooms we had reserved. One was wheelchair accessible. Called the desk to set up advertised "free" shuttle to Disney World and was told it would be $14 each and I had to call the company to schedule my own wheelchair accessible transportation. I asked" so it's not free any more?" and they replied no. After we went out to eat we noticed the sign on the motel had a running digital message about "free shuttles" and a free continental breakfast that we were not informed about. So we went back into the office to ask. We were given the "free" shuttle schedule then. AND the hours for breakfast. The newly renovated room #1120 had hardwood floors, 2 double beds, 32" flat screen tv, roll under vanity, raised toilet w/bars, handheld shower, shower chair without a back and a tub. It also had a safe, mini fridge and a coffee maker. It was definately a 2-star motel. The paint was chipped, the fixtures were not put in neatly, the furniture was old. The housekeeping employees were helpful but it's difficult when they don't speak English. In conclusion for $60 a night near Disney with all the location perks it was worth it but not a Hilton. : )

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tom S
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel on Priceline. The Claremont charged me another $4 per day as a "resort fee." That means that I paid Priceline and then I had to pay more money when I checked into the hotel. The room was filthy. I had to mop the floor with a wet towel in order to walk on it, without having my feet covered in dirt. There was no maid service at all. I spent two nights and no maid ever set foot in my room. When I went to plug in the clock radio, sparks shot out of the outlet. I told the manager, she went into another room supposedly to discuss my complaints, told me to come back in a half hour and nothing was done. I gave her my contact info. (cell number, name, etc.) and nobody has called me yet and that was three days ago. The only good thing about the hotel is that it is close to Disney World. One more thing. When I checked in at midnight, there was one clerk and ten people in front of me. It took around a half an hour to check in.

Reviews.Title: “45+ min check in? No access to rooms w/o maintenance coming to open it, whole stay? If you like that, STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: ohhector
Reviews.Content: 1) Total time from walking into lobby to check in, to walking into my room: 55 minutes. 2) Even with a check-in of 4PM (which is an hour later than almost every other hotel in the area), my room was not ready upon arrival at 7PM. I had to wait 15 minutes for them to check/clean my room. 3) Room I had reserved was a KING, they only had DOUBLES left. 4) Manager was completely rude and unprofessional, and uncaring about the issues at hand. She walked out of her "office" with an attitude and kept it the entire conversation I had with her. 5) There are multiple rooms across the property that have broken keycard locks (I counted 6 guests with issues the first night. Second day I counted 10 different people needing to be let into their rooms). This is an issue that has been going on for at least a week and a half (as is evidenced by complaints on the various web travel sites) that has not been addressed by the hotel. According to the maintenance crew, they are "waiting for parts from out of state" or "the technician didn't have time to get to your room today." The only way to get into your room is by walking to the lobby (which is pretty far from the rooms) and having them call maintenance out to open the door. 6) Those rooms with broken locks SHOULD NOT HAVE BEEN AVAILABLE FOR RENT. The management knew there was an issue and did not disclose the issue to any hotel customers that were checking in. The management claims it is a new problem, but it was confirmed to me by both employees and maintenance that it has been an ongoing problem. Why is this not illegal? 7) Also, it is VERY unsafe! They were not checking ID or anything, when letting people into rooms. Anyone could have very easily pretended to need to get into my "room" and have attacked me if I was there, or stolen things from me if I wasn't. Very unsafe. 8) The check-in staff LIED to customers on 5 different occasions in front of me (remember, I was in the lobby for over half an hour because my room was not ready and they gave me the wrong type room), stating that $4 "resort fee" they charge was for local taxes. Resort fees are ways for hotels to advertise lower prices online, and then charge a larger total amount later when the guest is checking in. This is no resort, and "resort fees" are NOT for local taxes, those are already paid in the original booking price. What they are doing is illegal, and they should be called out on it, especially since they are preying on tourists that do not know better. As for the rooms/hotel itself: 1) While I read a lot of recent reviews about messy rooms, mine was actually pretty clean. They wood laminate floor was definitely not mopped, but had been swept. I'd say it was 85% clean. 2) Room design was pretty nice, it's nice to not have the same "80s tropical" comforter that most hotels down here have. This would be the one saving grace of the hotel…it MIGHT have kept me as a customer here, had it not been for their abysmal customer service. 3) No wardrobe though, or any sort of cabinets to store clothes in the rooms. Only a metal shelf in the bathroom and a rod with 5 hangers. 4) No cups or ice buckets were available. 5) Wifi NEVER worked. Refused to connect. While I couldn’t really leave my building to check the other areas since my door lock was broken and I had the leave the door open, I walked down the hallways to make sure it wasn’t just my room. It wasn’t. All 3 times I was at the lobby for something, another customer was complaining about it. Slightly nice rooms aside, this was a terrible experience. I have never seen a hotel have such flagrant offenses when it comes to completely lack of care for customer service and safety. The hotel had NO right to let the rooms with malfunctioning door locks be available for rent, no matter if the hotel was overbooked and in demand of more rooms. There's a certain call for professionalism in favor of customer service and customer safety, and this hotel completely disregarded it. That, coupled with the lies of management and check in staff (1- management claiming the key lock issue was something new that happened that day, when clearly document online via travel forums by previous guests as well as the maintenance crew, and then not telling guests about it when they check in, 2 - the check-in staff claiming the "resort fee" is for local taxes) should show you that you should think twice about renting here, for the amount of consideration you will get as a guest. Sure, you could risk it...you might be one of those with a functioning door lock and might escape the issues I had...but it is a big gamble...is it worth it to you? I will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: speedwood
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel through reserveorlando.com and had many issues during our stay.....The bathtub was slippery and dirty, and the water never got hot. While we were away at Universal for the day we returned to find that our room was untouched by the maids so we had to go down to the office at 10:30pm to pick up clean towels and the staff didn't seem to care at all about it. The laminate floors were interesting but they were very dirty. We would wash our feet and after walking on the floor they ended up black again, yuck!!!!!!! We will not go back ever again.....we spoke with a representative from reserveorlando and were told they will speak to the staff at Claremont, but I really don't think anything will change for the better at this dump.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a JOKE!”
Reviews.Author: jrach
Reviews.Content: Claremont Kissimmee advertises their newly remodeled rooms but what they fail to tell you is.... they haven't cleaned them since. After a 30 minute wait to check in, we finally got our room keys. Exhausted after our 19 hour drive, we carried all of our luggage upstairs and into the room only to find it dirty, the cable didn't work, and the bathtub was clogged and FULL of filthy water. I picked up the phone to call the front desk and the phone didn't work! I went to the front desk and the rude desk clerk handed me a key to a different room. Frustrated, I went to check out the new room.....that room was being used as a storage room! Chairs, tables and boxes piled up to the ceiling! AGAIN I went BACK to the lobby and the rude desk clerk shrugged his shoulders and said, "That room is supposed to be clean". He gave me yet another key to a different room which didn't work. Finally we got into our room. The room was not clean, there was no dresser or ANYTHING to put clothes in, the cable didn't work (only a few channels), the wifi never worked our entire stay (we are still waiting for maintenance to come "reset the wifi button"), the phone didn't work, the bathroom was filthy and there were unidentified brown stains on the door and walls. This place is a dive! Anytime we called the front desk (with our cell phone since the one in our room didn't work), we were put on hold forever and most of the time they never got back to us, or if they did they would just say, "We will send maintenance." and nobody EVER came. We would ask for towels and NEVER get them. There were some shady characters hanging around. I'm pretty sure there were people living in the rooms below us. The rooms had the bare minimum. There was no ice bucket or bag, no extra towels, no paper or pen, and no "Do Not Disturb" sign. The continental breakfast was a joke....a couple donuts and some juice. This place was cheap...that's the only reason we stayed (besides we didn't feel like moving all of our stuff AGAIN).

Reviews.Title: “Wrong time to go, but close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: disneyrocksFlorida
Reviews.Content: I was the only one in the lobby and it took 45 min. to check in! Room was nice and big with flat screen tv, and the laminate floors were nice, but the place looked half way renovated, could have been cleaner, but it was just fine for the 1 night we stayed, booked 2 but decided to leave late that 2nd night. Did not feel the safest there, because the elevator was in a dark hallway and very small. Kinda scared late at night with kids. Feeling safe is important to travelers. More lights would be good. Room overall was nice as it had refridge, and big, but not enough cable channels. Rates were alright, but might stay in a hotel that has an inside room instead.

Reviews.Title: “Atrocious”
Reviews.Author: M E
Reviews.Content: We arrived at our destination at around 3am, and had to wait for our room keys for 45min to 1hr. When we finally made it to our rooms, we found that the keys did not work.. As though they weren't even activated. Nothing happened. We had to sit outside our room for a good 30-45 minutes to wait for a drunk man to open the doors with a master key. In our entire three-night stay, they never made us functioning keys.. Only another set of non-working keys, but I'm convinced they just handed the other ones back. Every night, after arriving late from Disney World with screaming little kids, exhausted, we had to sit outside and wait for them to come open the door.. Door situation aside, the bathroom was horrible. The bathtub faucet leaked non-stop, and our bathroom resembled a sauna when we first arrived. Everything was dripping wet. Which was never fixed.. And our toilet overflowed after the first use, so we had to wait hours for a man to come with a plunger.. And use the bathroom next door in the meantime. There was only one outlet in our room, and the holes were too big, so the plugs kept falling out.. The tv may have been a flat screen, but it had no plugs for external systems like the xbox we brought to play games as a family, and it only had about ten channels.. I'm convinced none of the linens were ever washed, and the hand towels absolutely reeked of bleach. Between the alcohol-ridden man in charge, and the presence of what appeared to be a.. uh, "courtesan" chatting up some guys on another floor, I didn't feel safe enough to leave my bags in the room during the day.. I felt the Disney World parking lot was safer.. I consider myself to be a well-traveled individual.. and overall, this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Next time I will make sure the person who books the hotel sticks with "name-brand" hotels, not just the cheapest option.. The only benefit this hotel has is its relatively close proximity to the Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia O
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever seen. We reserved a double DELUXE room for 3 adults. This is what we got. My first sight of waiting to get my room was a woman that was not dressed appropriately. She was a very large brested woman that was wearing an undershirt as a shirt. A nasty room that the top lock did not work, we had to move a chair in front of the door handle to feel safe. A tv with approx. 9 channels, one wash cloth to share between 3 adults, a shower curtain that had mold on it, dirty bed sheets and skirt. They said that the room was newly remolded, and this was the truth. The new vinyl floor that was put down after the carpet was ripped up left left holes around the edge of the wall. When we tried to get on the wireless internet, no luck, called the front lobby for help and got a very rude, scarcastic woman that was no help at all. We never could get on. Please do not stay here unless there is absolutley no other placed to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tower of terror but convinent”
Reviews.Author: catercarrie
Reviews.Content: To start off our 5 night stay we checked into a room that the keys did not open the door had to have staff use a master key to let us in to be promised it would be fixed first thing in the am after being gone for 15hrs came back door still not fixed they offered to change our room we looked at the available room to find that anyone could enter the room by simply pushing hard enough on the door apparently it had been kicked in before the whole door casing was loose so we chose to keep our old room making sense no keys & no entry other than hotel staff is safer than anyone forcing entry into our room. And so for 5 days we had the luxury of being escorted and let into our room. Housekeeping only changed linens and towels & took trash out when you demanded it but of course then not only did you get fresh towels you got a bonus their attitudes!! And as for their continental breakfast don't bother room too small and limited quanity of food they seem to run out very early. Oh and on my last morning while I am laying in bed getting ready to get up and pack I was greeted by an unexpected guest crawling up my bed I guess he was letting me know my time was up it was check out time because he was moving in!! All and all I will give thumbs up to the all the desk clerks they were polite and never got upset no matter how much hell everyone was giving them and yes that's all I seen my 5 nights there a whole lot of unhappy guest it was obivious I wasn't the only 1 without keys to my room and having a bad experience I would never recommend this hotel anyone no matter how cheap you can get the room for and I am not a hard person to please but this place is ridicolous !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of false advertising”
Reviews.Author: Hector M
Reviews.Content: After reviewing their ads I decided to give it a try. Boy, was I misled! Beds are terrible; elevator filthy and smelly; furniture does not match; bathroom fixtures do not work properly; bathroom floor looks like a murder scene; tv carries 10 stations, etc. What really got me was that I filed a complaint and they didn't follow up on their promise of changing our room. Yes, you get what you pay for, but don't expect to get a good nights sleep should you happen to place two adults in one bed. Creaky, noisy, bumpy and uncomfortable. There's always a last time for everything, and this was it!

Reviews.Title: “Worst service”
Reviews.Author: Kellyn B
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I ever been to had to wait more then 45minutes for check in worst service front desk horrible No help at all they gave attitude crazy and was charged for a night that I never request and was charged worst hotel never ever would I ever be going to this hotel again so if your thinking of booking here please don't you will regret it just like I do Worst Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic need I say more.”
Reviews.Author: Joseph S
Reviews.Content: First thing, we tried to check in at 4:00 just to find our rooms not done yet. Afterwords they decided to put us in another building away from the pool where we were suppossed to be. Next the rooms they said were newly renovated right, mismatching furniture, a whole 10 T.V. networks joy what a great room, thank God in didn't rain. Towel racks falling off the wall in the vanity area, beds none of the linen matched, floors were just dirty from not being kept clean, and the awsome view of brick walls, oh yes don't let me forget toilets were not cleaned for 3 days, and the open wires that gave my sister a shock. This is the third year we've stayed here and the rooms were never this bad, the only thing they've updated is hardwood floors and a coat of paint on the outside. It should be condemmed or torn down. On top of that the area for washing 2 broke washers and a broke dryer, the building is right next to the pool which also should be shut down. I don't know how this eyesore remains open they must pay OSHA some nice fines. The rates are way too much, you would be safer under an overpass on I-4.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and a nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jo-travel-alot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on Feb 25th with my two teenage sons. We were in the area to go to Disney for the day before our cruise. I booked this hotel on Hotwire for $27. Let me tell you, our room looked just like the pics on the hotel website. We had two dbl beds, microwave, fridge, flat screen TV, and nice white down comforters. The room had hardwood floors and our socks did not become black or dirty. The room had soap, shampoo, and lotion. We also had a coffee maker, iron, and ironing board. The beds were comfortable and we slept well. The bathroom was clean, but not spotless. I used the laundry room and it was clean. The pool appeared to be nice, but it was too cool to enjoy. The breakfast was nice and there were plenty of seats available. The only cons would be the carpet in the elevator was beyond dirty and gross. The stairs were also kind of dirty. I'm not sleeping in the elevator or on the stairs, so no big deal to me. I was very pleased with this hotel for the price I paid and would recommend to others looking for a cheap place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: SojournTruth
Reviews.Content: I didn't read the reviews for this hotel until after I booked and paid for it up front, and I wondered what I got myself into. The reviews were so negative, but I just don't get it. I thought it was a great place for the money. The most important thing to me at any hotel at any price is that it's clean, and my room here was definitely clean and well kept. The location is also great for visits to Disney. Yes, the place has its quirks—I had to figure out the technique for turning off the bathroom faucet, there was an overly aggressive timeshare salesman stationed in the lobby—but for the price, those minor inconveniences were worth it. Some of the reviews mentioned bugs, and I did see two or three tiny ants. I live in Miami and have this kind of ants in my home once in awhile, so I know that they have nothing to do with a place not being clean. They just happen to exist in Florida, no biggie. I'd rather have two or three bugs the size of a speck of dust than major chemical fumigation. The one complaint that I do have is that I was charged a resort fee, which was never mentioned during booking or check in. Only $4/night, but still disappointing that it was never mentioned and just popped up on my credit card statement.

Reviews.Title: “The only reason I rated a one is because I can't rate in the negatives. I stayed on 2_17_12 and the bathtube full of pubic hair ”
Reviews.Author: mildredmdn
Reviews.Content: Say the least, we stayed for about 5 hours. I asked for a refund manager by name sandra or cindy didn't want to refund! This place needs to b shut down!! I disputed and will contact the health department on them asap! This place is nasty and the also have false advertising (newly renovated room) yeah right!! This place is the worst ever!

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Anne W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated about 1 mile from the exit to the DisneyTheme Parks. Coffee shops and restaurants nearby. Average hotel in this price range. Large double room. Refrigerator and microwave made our stay more comfortable. Bathroom was just okay, could use some work. Towels were thin and very rough, not nice to use. Pillows were too soft. I had to keep fluffing and folding mine to try to get a comfortable sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible.....”
Reviews.Author: Lorrie L
Reviews.Content: Stay away..This place ruined my vacation! Got to my room @ 10.00 pm and checked in and went to my room...upon going in my room first thing I noticed was ants on the sink. I was so tired that I looked over it and killed them and got in my bed. About 30 mins later I got woke up to maintenance removing furniture from the room above me and remodeling the room..at 11 pm..called front desk and she said she would take care of it,it still did not stop. It was not as loud but it still continued. When we woke up I went to the front desk and spoke to the manager and she has the worst attitude. Argued with me about what they where doing in the room. I walked outside and watched them for several minutes before I called front desk. Told her if they was going to be remodeling the room above me that they need to move me. Went about my day and all day thought about having to stay there for a week and decided I was checking out and finding a another room..All of that together was not working for me and I have not got to the best part. Roaches,Ants,Under the beds have 3 inches of dirt and there was items under the bed. Rude manager..When I was checking out the clerk asked for my credit card so he could return the charge(which they should have never charged wanted to pay cash) and without telling me he had made a mistake and charged me again,asked for my card one more time and then said. Ok I charge you two times but I returned it.Sorry. Ok I am not rich and this was my debit card..Thats 321.80 x2= 643.00 of my money tied up because it takes 2-5 days for a credit to be applied to your account. The money did not clear until the day I was leaving to come home. The worst experience ever! I was so close to leaving and coming home at that moment. However went right down the road to Baymont Inn and got the best room. Really need a whole new staff at that hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, besides location there's nothing good about this dump!”
Reviews.Author: Katherinemoon
Reviews.Content: Stay away the bad reviews are not even close to the nightmare of this place. Roaches, bugs, no staff, the manager is the most rude and low person I have ever met. She has no idea on what managing a hotel means, speaks broken english and cant seem to understand either, nothing agains Hispanics but if you prentend to work in a hotel at least speak the language. No words for her rudeness. Rooms dont look like the pictures. Very run down hotel, dirty and at nights like a ghost town. If you dont want your vacations ruined lOok for another place. There are plenty of hotels in the same area with transportation to the parks and real breakfast for the same price. Dont even bother.

Reviews.Title: “did the trick for us”
Reviews.Author: tulipgirl74
Reviews.Content: We had none of the problems other posters talk about. Our room was clean and no bugs were seen. (I'd be the first to high tail it out of there if there had been!! I HATE bugs.) The room was nice looking upon entering. The bathroom was in the midst of being redone, so the toilet wobbled when you sat on it and the tile was 2 different kinds. But when the toilet wouldn't work, maintenance came down immediately and fixed it. The room was quiet, the bed was comfortable, no bugs, and we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is conveniently located between a Waffle House and an Ihop, so we didn't have breakfast. The daytime staff was surly, but the night guy was nice enough and (again) got maintenance to our room ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't even rate one star”
Reviews.Author: anniedosamiga
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property when it was Howard Johnson and found it to be clean and good for price. I booked this stay when it was still HoJo and will never stay here again. The place is poorly maintained. The rooms were not tended to during the day, so no towels and beds unmade. There were no glasses in the room on check in and two phone calls to the front desk did not produce any either. The safe was locked and maintainence never came to unlock. The coffee pot was broken. The beds are mounted on 2X4 pieces of lumber. There was no microwave as advertised on booking. Front desk said it would cost extra. Come on people...

Reviews.Title: “SCARY, HORRIBLE, DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: JANET637
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at 7pm after travelling from Manchester only to wait 2 hours in a queue to be checked in as so many people were complainging, whilst we were waiting the girl on reception had had enough and went and got her jacket and left, when I asked to speak to the manager the guy behind the counter said he was and I asked what was going on, he said he did not know and his staff just kept walking out and it was hard to get staff!! after getting key to room we walked across a dark parking lot to what I can only describe as a disgusting room, the VERY young girl who was the cleaner asked if she could help, came in and emptied some of the empty beer cans which were in the bin and using the same cloth wiped over the toilet and bath, the bathroom was disgusting, cracked tiles, toilet and bath badly scraped and dirty my husband opened the fridge and to our disgust this hadnt been cleaned either, we went back to the reception and advised we would not stay in this room and demanded another which we got but to our horror it was worse than the first one. Masking tape was used to keep on the bathroom tiles. We went back to reception only to be told their is nothing they could do, advised not wanting them to do anything other than giving me a full refund, would rather sleep in car. Booked via Booking.com who agreed they would give us a full refund which they faxed confirmation of thru to hotel before I would leave. I would not recommed this hotel to anyone, thankfully my children were not with us. We tried every other hotel nearby but due to the time of year they were all fully booked and we did end up sleeping in car. We were in Orlando to surprise my sister and my children who were on holiday thinking we were still at home, due to the time of night we would not disturb them but headed to their villa in morning and stayed there for the 2 weeks. This is one of the most horrific holiday experience we have ever had and and would not wish it on anyone.

Reviews.Title: “TRAGIC”
Reviews.Author: Jordan B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nightmare. We happened to be there when it was quite cold and the heater didn't even work. The phone didn't work either and the staff was rude and unhelpful. They did as little as they possibly could and the person who checked us in had to have help from two other workers, because he had no idea what he was doing. The continental breakfast was a joke as well. I left a hair straightener there by accident and called the very next day about it. They claimed they would check into it ASAP and I never heard anything from them. We don't live too far away so we actually drove up there that day and called while sitting in the parking lot and watched them ignore our calls. This place is only in business because of the Disney Parks near them, they should be shut down.

Reviews.Title: “One word " HORRIBLE"”
Reviews.Author: Biddi58
Reviews.Content: If you want to ruin your vacation is the best place to do it. No services, dirty, rude and careless staff, no maid arose only in the week. We stayed there because there were no other rooms in this holiday season and no question to be refund. We booked through Booking.com at low prices ... we have paid dearly to learn! Please RUN it's a NIGHTMARE !

Reviews.Title: “con artists with ur credit card info”
Reviews.Author: stephanie w
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel many times in 6 years going to Disney. Booked online thru Howard Johnson website, was unaware that it was no longer Howard Johnson. Drove 1200 miles in 1 day with my 3 children. Got there and saw new sign up. Went to check in and was told they bought Howard Johnson and changed the name. they left website up and take peoples money. I called HOJO and they told me they have to honor it, but they wouldnt.Then called back to HOJO and make lady take my cell phone and talk to her. HOJO said they cant give a refund since every hotel is independatly owned and operated. That was in the agreement when they bought it. So they have reservations coming in from their NEW website and old Howard Johnsons website. Check it out look up Howard Johnson Maingate East , same pics, address and phone number.Call the number and they answer as the Claremont Inn. Lots of other people in lobby also ripped off. They had booked it online also and it was also still named Howard Johnson. Called credit card and they said the money went to them. I did not get a refund. They were very rude and said they cant help me. I told them I have 3 little girls and myself, I have no where to go this was all prepaid for. They didnt care. They ignored all of us in lobby and asked us to leave. Booked 7 days in the family suite. Out over $1000 dollars. Started calling around other hotels. Since it was the week of xmas thru new years, NO ROOMS ANYWHERE!! Slept in car in parking lot until they told me to leave the property. Drove home the next morning.Got home and called credit card again and someone was making purchases with my card number.The only thing I charged on that card was the room and that was months ago. Now have to go thru all the fraud dept protocol to clear myself. The card is completly unusable until the investigation is over. Was out all that money, took my vacation time off work, and disappointed my children. This hotel is a rip off. They defrauded alot of people. Was told by local, lots of hotels changing names and tourists are stuck down there with no where to go. They change names constantly and wont honor your reservation with payment. Do not stay anywhere on 192 also known as Irlo Bronson Highway. They are all dangerous places and run down.

Reviews.Title: “Completely incompetent”
Reviews.Author: Becky S
Reviews.Content: Took us over an hour and a half to check in. Why? Because after a half an hour of standing in line, the girl at the counter tells us that Expedia never sent them our reservation and we need to have them call the hotel. So we then spend over 45 minutes on the phone with Expedia, only to find out the reason it's taking so long is the people at the counter aren't freaking answering the phone. I then have to wait another 10 minutes behind two other guests having massive problems, hand the guy at the counter my cell, only to find out that guess what? They really DID have the reservation the whole time. After a really lame apology (including telling me that sometimes travel is just frustrating, and he knows how that feels because they were busy the other day) he promises he will do whatever he can to make it better. Know what they did? Noted our account that we had a problem checking in. That's it. Nothing at all whatsoever. The TV got like 10 really fuzzy channels, the tissues felt like paper towels, and the last day we were there housekeeping only left us one bath towel for 2 people..... If I could give them less that a rating of 1, I would.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Content: The room itself is adequate, and the location is good (near restaurants and Disney parks). The breakfast is so-so, but a lady is staying in the doorway checking your name before you are allowed to come. There are not enough tables in the breakfast room, so you have to stay in line and wait. The service is really bad. The bath tub was dirty when we arrived, and it was never cleaned despite we asked to do it many times. The bath mat was torn and was not glued properly, so it was floating when we were taking a shower. The was some black stuff underneath the bath mat. Overall the bathroom was disgusting. We asked to bring a roll of toilet paper in the morning, and it was not there we came in the evening. Same thing with the bar soap. We asked to bring more bars of soap – and we never received them. There were not enough towels. It was almost impossible to regulate the water temperature in the shower. The handle of shower switch was broken. The toilet was not flushing properly, and we asked to fix it – it was never fixed. Try to avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for our family of 5”
Reviews.Author: mdinmayretta
Reviews.Content: Background: Family of 5 - three boys ages 11, 11, and 9. the good: if you're looking for an extremely affordable, clean, safe place to stay off park for Disney that is close to the park, you cannot go wrong here. the bad: We made reservations online and it said roll away bed was included; it was not resulting in $10 a day fee for use. But, these rooms are so cheap, it's hard to complain about that. Although, the front desk was a little huffy about it. We bought 10 day non-expiring passes a while back and ended up with 2 days on our passes. We wanted to make a cheap run to Disney and we were looking for a place to stay that was very affordable (which meant off Disney grounds of course), safe, clean, and as close to the park as possible. We booked through Hotels.com and, I have to admit, given the price ($25 a night), I was very skeptical about the safety and cleanliness of the place. But, we decided to roll the dice. I am glad we did. The hotel was small and it's not luxurious by any stretch but, the staff that greeted us was friendly (although, not all were during our stay) and our room was clean and functional. Not pretty, and bed was not great but.. good enough. The location to the park is excellent (quick right, half mile to on-ramp, and you enter the park). And the hotel is immediately next to (can walk) a waffle house and IHOP (although both were so incredibly packed each day, we did not use). There is a chik-fil-a across the street that was great (next to a gas station / quick trip also) and we used the drive thru on our way out to the park. We used our room to sleep in and that was it. And if that's all your looking for to make a economy trip to Disney, this place is more than perfect. Rooms were clean and functional. Beds were ok but not bad. parking and overall area felt safe and it was very quiet. They have a pool that is very basic but we did not use. the only issue we had was, Hotels.com stated we could get a roll away bed at no charge and the hotel staff said that was not true. After a little arguing we decided to let it go ($10 a day for usage) given the price of the room. But, the staff seemed to not really care about the cost being misrepresented on hotels.com and told us to take it up with them. Again, we decided to let it go given the overall cost.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever book this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I ever stayed at. I booked it via Expedia counting on them that they have some minimum standards for the hotel they show. This hotel is dirty, neglected, in my room there were water coming underneth the floor and we had to put towels on the floor everyday. Although we asked them to come and fix it, they didn't. Also, the air condition was so loud we had to turn in off. They also didnt clean the room or replace the sheets all week long and on the last night they didn't even fixed the beds. If you count on the shuttle to and from the parks please keep in mind that it is a bus that gets full in seconds and eventually ou are standing all the way to the park with around 40 people (in addition to the other 50 that are sitting). Bottom line - don't go to this place and try to stay with 3 stars hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: Rabecka L
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at this hotel. They have very poor management, poor house keeping, and unorganized help services. Not only that, they also book rooms to more than 2 people, and they fight in front of customers. If you plan on staying in this hotel please do not come. I repeat do not.

Reviews.Title: “Find some where else to stay”
Reviews.Author: marysharon
Reviews.Content: There is 2 things good about this hotel. The beds were very comfy and location is great. The rooms are small. The air conditioner was so loud we had to take the cover off the front to be able to sleep so it wouldn't rattle. Our parents in the room next door had water running out of light and fan in bathroom. We told them and they did nothing till I went to front desk and B&%$#. Then they fixed it. Room service also sucked, they didn't replace the cups when out we had to go to the front desk and get them ourselves. They never swept or dusted the floors. Ceiling dust was falling onto the floor and no one wiped it up. Breakfast wasn't worth the effort when Denny's is on the same block. If you can afford it --- stay some place else.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: john b
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and I would recommend staying at this hotel. The rooms are nice and clean plus they have ROOM SERVICE w/ a plastic menu in the rooms where you can order some very good food along with good service. Staff is helpful with good room rates. when I come back to this location I'm coming.

Reviews.Title: “It's amazing how bad it was”
Reviews.Author: Hydronly
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a package deal including flight via Expedia. I don't know exactly how much we payed per night but it was almost for free. However I wish we choose another hotel.. After a 12 hour flight we arrived late at the hotel, at checkin they told us we booked and payed for one night. We told them we booked and payed for a package deal and got a reservation for 21 nights. Clearly something wrong with the communication between them and Expedia. This has never happened before and we book hotels via Expedia all the time. He literally told us to go fix this with Expedia. Of course I told him it was not our problem but theirs. We never heard about it again our entire stay. So I guess they fixed it. We got a room in the third building. Beware, if you do not have a car, walking from the lobby to your room can take about 5 – 6 minutes if you're in the third building. The room was ok, the beds were clean but housekeeping did not come every day! Even when we left very early sometimes they would just not be made when we got back. There was a old TV and the reception was very bad. Also the plumbing in the third building is terrible. First time at night when we were a sleep our neighbor took a shower and it sounded like the entire building was coming down. Security even came to check it out but it turned out to be bad plumbing. So bring earplugs. Also because there is a lot of construction going on in the area, when we were there the construction on the parcel next to the hotel started at about 7 am in the morning. The staff doesn't care about your good night sleep either. One night they woke us up by moving televisions in the rooms next to us in the middle of the night. I called front desk because I thought they might be thieves. The worst thing of all for me was, they advertise with free WiFi but do not note online anywhere that it is only available at the front lobby. So when you need to get online to check something real quick thats a total of 12 minutes walking to front lobby and back. Not convenient at all since I need to be online often for work. Because of this we asked back for the $4 per day resort fee they charge. They agreed to pay back and said it was going to take 5 days. After a week we asked again and they told us we receive it back when we leave. We did get it back, $84 for 21 nights. Ok it can not get much worse right? Wrong! We went on a road trip via Miami and the Everglades to the Keys. After 4 days we got back to the Claremont in Kissimmee at night. We were very tired of the 8 hour drive from the Keys and were glad we got back to the hotel. But there was a note on our door saying we had to leave the room because the next morning it was going to get renovated! So in the middle of the night after a 8 hour drive they wanted us to pack all our things and move to a room in a different building. He gave us a new room and when we got there the door jammed, at least I thought it did. So I was very mad and kicked it in, turned out he gave us the wrong room. It was not jammed but locked from the inside and there were people sleeping... Of course they woke up scared and screamed at me! We went back to the front-desk and told the guy what happened, you should have seen his face... The next room he gave us he checked out himself, to see if there was nobody in there. The location is great. It's close to Disney and they have a free shuttle that picks you up in the morning and brings you back to the hotel at night. When you get to Disney you can use the free Disney shuttles and monorail to get to any park you like. If you want to use the shuttle to get to Sea World or Universal they charge $15 per person. The hotel is in walking distance from Kissimmee Old Town, you will find many places to eat and shop there. You can also go to Celebration for dinner, that town (previously owned by Disney) is worth a visit. So the hotel is a absolute hell hole and is lacking in management and service. Location is pretty good and the free shuttle to Disney is great if you're planning on visiting the Disney parks. But almost all hotels in this area offer a free Disney shuttle so I would strongly advice to go somewhere else. Cheap does not always have to mean bad, just here it does!

Reviews.Title: “Not good but now bad either”
Reviews.Author: Tanja W
Reviews.Content: We initially made the reservations at the Howard Johnson Maingate East , which a few weeks before we got there had changed and was now the Claremont Kissimmee Hotel. We did not know this, but thankfully there was no problem at all checking in as they honored all reservations made for Hojo. They were busy making changes renovating etc. but we had no problem with noise etc. We had a newly renovated room , although still just a bit outdated it was just fine for the purpose of our stay. We did not pass much time in the hotel as we were out all day going to parks, and at night it was a very comfy night of sleep. Initially we had some issues that some lights were not working, no ice bucket and no cups for water or coffee, also our floors were not really clean. but as soon as I asked they made sure that the next day by the time we came back everything was fixed and clean. Beds are very clean bathroom as well, they replace all linens and towels everyday. My mother also got a newly renovated room that was changed later on as the shower pressure was not right, phone nor tv remote worked and toilet kept running , they fixed some but changed the room anyway to a great room with no problems at all. Our king size room had no closet or drawer space however mom's double did have plenty. Overall service is great and I expect this hotel to become even better once fully renovated. I would stay there again. I would definitely recommend this area if you want to be near everything in Orlando, plenty to do , even in walking distance. Like Shopping miniature Golf , enough food. and near by you have Walmart, outlets gift shops . Most important it it close to I-Drive and very close to Disney, literally less than 10 minutes away from all the fun stuff. If you don't have a car there are buses running right in front of the hotel and shuttles to take you to parks. \Disney, Universal and Islands of adventure, are AWESOME this time of year! We finished all four parks of Disney in 3 days and 2 days (with time to spare) for Universal and Islands of adventure. The lines are short. The longest we had to wait in line was at the new Harry Potter attraction in the castle which we waited about half an hour for. AAAAAAAALLLLLLLLLLLLL other lines in both parks AND in Disney also ALLLL lines were SUPER short , like a max of a 10 Minute wait..... even to meet characters!!!!! So if you are planning a trip for these parks I would 100% recommend to go in the last week of September to first week of October! Awesome!!! Make sure you buy a poncho for those wet rides , when you don't want to get wet, also great for when it starts to rain, you can go to shows and wait it out while others hide! believe me it is hot! so shorts and tanks would be best and lots of sunscreen. Make sure you wear sneakers, with so much walking you need good walking gear! I would recommend the Florida mall, West Oak mall ( its less hectic) and Orlando Fashion square. For your shopping for lat minute stuff you forgot in the parks , Universal's City Walk and Downtown Disney will sell mostly the same merchandise. Disney parks are awesome , something every kid would love! I would say go with older kids cuz the sun wears most kids out by 1 pm if you go in the morning. I saw plenty kids KO in their strollers by then. However kids of the age of 8 and up usually get the bigger bang for your buck :)

Reviews.Title: “poorly run”
Reviews.Author: mmichelle2011
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through travelocity for 13 nights in August 2011. Hotel description included free WI-FI and kids eat free at the next door IHOP. There was no internet connection in my room and they refused to move me to a building which included Wi-Fi. Also, kids eat free deal expired months before and was no longer valid. False advertizing and terrible costumer service. I would not recommend it to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Claremont Kissimmee Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 6051 W Irlo Bronson Memorial Hwy, Kissimmee, FL 34747 (Formerly Howard Johnson Inn Kissimmee Maingate East)
